OCD.name: HttpService
OCD.description: This service allows the user to enable and configure the http and https connectors in Kura web server. Every change to this service will cause a restart of the web server and a possible temporary UI unavailability.

AD.name: HTTP Enabled
AD.description: Specifies if the http service is enabled.

AD.name: HTTP Port
AD.description: Allows to specify the port used by the http service for plain, unencrypted communication.

AD.name: HTTPS Enabled
AD.description: Specifies if the https service is enabled.

AD.name: HTTPS Port
AD.description: Allows to specify the port used by the https service for encrypted communication.

AD.name: HTTPS Client Authentication Enabled
AD.description: Specifies if the HTTPS client autentication is enabled on the dedicated port.

AD.name: HTTPS Client Authentication Port
AD.description: Allows to specify the port used by the https service for encrypted communication with client authentication.

AD.name: HTTPS Keystore Path
AD.description: Specifies the path to the keystore used for https communication.

AD.name: HTTPS Keystore Password
AD.description: Specifies the password for accessing and verifying the configured keystore.

AD.name: Https Revocation Check Enabled
AD.description: Specifies whether to check revocation status of client certificats.

AD.name: Https Client Revocation URL
AD.description: Specifies the URI for OCSP responders.

AD.name: Https Client CRL path
AD.description: Specifies the path for the CRL for client certificate revocation check.

AD.name: Https Revocation Soft-fail Enabled
AD.description: Specifies whether the revocation soft fail is enabled or not. If it is enabled and the gateway is not able verify the revocation status of a client certificate (for example due to a connectivity problem), the certificate will be rejected.
